metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3471 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.45 and earlier and 5.6.26 andearlier allows local users to affect confidentiality, integrity, andavailability via vectors related to Server: Option.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mariadb-client - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-common - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-connect-engine-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-oqgraph-engine-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-server - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-test - 10.0.21-1
mariadb-test-10.0 - 10.0.21-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.21-1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
